meanings.definition: The quality or state of being regal or royal.
meanings.sent1: Her kingliness shone through as she greeted the guests with grace.
meanings.sent2: The kingliness of the palace was evident in its grand architecture.
meanings.sent3: The cat strutted around the house with a sense of kingliness, demanding treats.
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood with a kingliness that commanded awe from all who beheld it.
meanings.sent5: The kingliness of the ancient crown sparkled in the dimly lit room.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being majestic or grand.
meanings.sent1: The kingliness of the waterfall captivated all who witnessed its power.
meanings.sent2: The kingliness of the mountain range stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to rule her toy kingdom with a sense of kingliness.
meanings.sent4: The kingliness of the oak tree's branches reached towards the sky in a regal display.
meanings.sent5: The kingliness of the lion in the wild struck fear into the hearts of its prey.

meanings.definition: The behavior or demeanor befitting a king.
meanings.sent1: His kingliness was evident in the way he carried himself with dignity and authority.
meanings.sent2: The kingliness of the knight was admired by all in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to mimic the kingliness of its owner by sitting on a throne of pillows.
meanings.sent4: The kingliness of the peacock's strut caught the attention of all nearby.
meanings.sent5: The kingliness of the actor on stage commanded the attention of the entire audience.
